data: Dedication of a pavement by Klodianus and Mousa

Del Muto refers in intial report to a mosaic found together with an inscription; Carnazza (a Taormina antiquarian) in a contemporary report writes of 'una lapide di marmo in cui sono incise delle lettere greche', found in two rooms adorned with mosaics and marble elements. No further elements of description are provided, but it seems that it constituted part of the pavement. Ferrua's statement that it appears to have been executed in mosaic as part of a pavement is erroneous.
apographs record lunate epsilon and sigma, and minuscule omega (it is unclear why Muscolino refers to rhomboid omicron (p.111), since neither apograph presents such a form).
later Roman/early Christian on the basis of the formulae.

Found in spring 1810 (prior to 3 April) in excavations conducted by Fagan and Del Muto in Taormina, in the context of ancient baths in 'via Crucis', assumed to be in the area of via Bagnoli Croci, below and to the south of the ancient theatre. Kaibel's statement that it was found in 1823 is a misreading of Morso. Found in two rooms decorated with mosaics and marble decorative elements. Not seen more recently.
Inscriptiones Graecae Siciliae et Italiae, additis graecis Galliae Hispaniae, Britanniae, Germaniae inscriptionibus

G. Kaibel, Inscriptiones Graecae Siciliae et Italiae, Additis Graecis Galliae Hispaniae, Britanniae, Germaniae Inscriptionibus, Inscriptiones Graecae Consilio et Auctoritate Academiae Litterarum Regiae Borussicae Editae. Volumen XIV., XIV (Berlin: Georgius Reimerus, 1890)
Note e giunte alle iscrizioni cristiane antiche della Sicilia
Antonio Ferrua, Note e giunte alle iscrizioni cristiane antiche della Sicilia (Vatican, 1989)
Una probabile iscrizione pavimentale di Taormina (IG, XIV, 446) con la formula ὑπὲρ εὐχῆς

Francesco Muscolino, «Una probabile iscrizione pavimentale di Taormina (IG, XIV, 446) con la formula ὑπὲρ εὐχῆς», in Atti del XXII Colloquio dell’Associazione Italiana per lo studio e la conservazione del mosaico, a c. di Claudia Angelelli, Daniela Massara, e Andrea Paribeni (Tivoli: Edizioni Scripta Manent, 2017), 107–16
Lettera del beneficiale dot. Salvadore Morso ... al sig. D. Agostino Gallo
Salvadore Morso, «Lettera del beneficiale dot. Salvadore Morso ... al sig. D. Agostino Gallo», Giornale di scienze, letteratura ed arti per la Sicilia 4 (1823): 166–68
Κλωδιανὸς κὲκαὶ Μοῦσα σὺν πεδίοις ὑπὲρ εὐχῆς ἐποίησαν
dedication of a pavement by klodianus and mousa
ISic001271. Dedication of a pavement by Klodianus and Mousa

2κὲ Μοῦσα
3σὺν πεδίο̣[ις]
4ὑπὲρ εὐχῆς
5 ἐπ[οίησ]αν

l.2 reg., orig. κὲ

1ΚΛΩΔΙ[..]ΟΣ
2ΚΕΜΟΥΣΑ
3ΣΥΝΠΕΔΙ.[..]
4ΥΠΕΡΕΥΧΗΣ
5ΕΠ[....]ΑΝ

l.2 reg., orig. κὲ

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text of Muscolino;
  • 6: Kaibel after Morso: ἐπέθηκαν

English translation

Jonathan Prag

Klodianos and Mousa, together with their offspring, made this on account of a prayer/vow

commentary

Muscolino offers a revised reading, based upon a newly discovered apograph of 1810 from the time of the discovery, which diverges from that, based upon a separate apograph, of Morso 1823. Muscolino concludes that the text was incised on a marble plaque as part of a decorative stone floor, rather than being a mosaic text.
